actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the previous order of the House of July 17, 2023, the House proceeded with 30 minutes of debate on H.J. Res. 79.
Considered pursuant to a previous order. H.J. Res. 79 — "Relating to a national emergency declared by the President on May 11, 2004."
Consideration initiated pursuant to a previous order.

At the conclusion of debate on H.J. Res. 71, the Chair put the question on passage and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Mr. Crane demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to a previous  order of the House.
Pursuant to the previous order of the House of July 13, 2023, the House proceeded with 30 minutes of debate on H.J. Res. 71.
Considered pursuant to a previous order. H.J. Res. 71 — "Relating to a national emergency declared by the President on May 22, 2003."
Consideration initiated pursuant to a previous order.

At the conclusion of debate on H.J. Res. 74, the Chair put the question on passage and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Mr. Gosar demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to a previous  order of the House.
Pursuant to the previous order of the House of July 13, 2023, the House proceeded with 30 minutes of debate on H.J. Res. 74.
Considered pursuant to a previous order. H.J. Res. 74 — "Relating to a national emergency declared by the President on May 16, 2012."
Consideration initiated pursuant to a previous order.

At the conclusion of debate on H.J. Res. 70, the Chair put the question on passage and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Mr. Gosar demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to a previous  order of the House.
Pursuant the previous order of the House of July 13, 2023, the House proceeded with 30 minutes of debate on H.J. Res. 70.
Considered pursuant to a previous order. H.J. Res. 70 — "Relating to a national emergency declared by the President on February 25, 2011."
Consideration initiated pursuant to a previous order.

At the conclusion of debate on H.J. Res. 68, the Chair put the question on passage and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Mrs. Boebert demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to a previous  order of the House.
Pursuant to the previous order of the House of July 13, 2023, the House proceeded with 30 minutes of debate on H.J. Res. 68.
Considered pursuant to a previous order. H.J. Res. 68 — "Relating to a national emergency declared by the President on October 27, 2006."
Consideration initiated pursuant to a previous order.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 213
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213

actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 597.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 597 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3935) to amend title 49, United States Code, to reauthorize and improve the Federal Aviation Administration and other civil aviation programs, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3941) to prohibit the use of the facilities of a public elementary school, a public secondary school, or an institution of higher education to provide shelter for aliens who have not been admitted into the United States, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Robert Garcia of CA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 18.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Blake D. Moore to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
